reviews.text: Draught at Lost Abbey/ Port Brewing Taproom San Marcos, 23.4.16. Black with a beige head. Vanilla, coconut, a little ink and cocoa nibs in the nose, bitter, ink, medicinal/ alcoholic in the mouth, but the alcohol becomes subtle in the second sip. Full body, a little fizzy, iodine in the finish. Rich and good.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Stasâs place. Thanks Vova. Clear golden with a big white head. Decent aroma of malt, a bit bready, a bit grainy, and some grassy hops. Flavor has mild malty sweetness and mild bitter grassy/herbal hops finish. Light to medium-bodied. Decent.

At a tasting, thanks, small bubbly creamy head, hazy cloudy lightish brown color, grainy slightly nutty aroma with hint of dark fruit, jammy fruity flavor with nuts andl light candy notes and caramel. Muddled brew.
